Hi Gordon,
Thank you for your quick response. I did as you said and it work=
ed,
Thanks a lot.

About multiple queuing(question 2):
I read at the Heritr=
ix 3 new features that it has:
"# Introduction of parallel queues.  When cr=
awling specific sites that can handle large amounts of traffic, the paralle=
l queues option can be used to open many concurrent crawling connections to=
 a single site."

meaning if I want to crawl only a specific site by multip=
le connections how can I do it? 

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, G=
ordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> On 12/16/10 1:39 AM, yotpo.official wrot=
e:
> > Hi,
> > I'm pretty new to Heritrix 3 and despite my very good impres=
sion of the code and it's ability, I'm having problems with a couple of thi=
ngs:
> >
> > 1. How do I config the cxml file so I will crawl only in a spe=
cific domain, lets say http://example.com and only in sub domains of it?
> =
> meaning if there is a url ads.google/.... i dont want to even fetch it.
>=
 
> See the first Frequently-Asked-Question listed on the project wiki, 
> =
'unexpected offsite content':
> 
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display=
/Heritrix/FAQs
> 
> > 2. How do i make the multiple queuing to work? does i=
t happens automatically?
> 
> What do you mean by "multiple queueing"?
> 
>=
 > 3. I configed the cxml file so I wont process all the jpg/gif/png files =
but my logs still show me (Mimetypes) i process them.  this is what I did:
=
> > <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.MatchesListRegexDecideRu=
le">
> >            <property name=3D"decision" value=3D"REJECT"/>
> >     =
  <!--<property name=3D"listLogicalOr" value=3D"true" />  -->
> >       <!-=
-<property name=3D"regexList">
> >             <list>
> >                  =
 <value>.*(?i)(\.css(\?.*)?)$</value>
> >                   <value>.*(\.bmp=
|\.gif|\.jpg|\.png|bmp))$</value>
> >             </list>
> >            </=
property>  -->
> >      </bean>
> >
> > what is my mistake??
> 
> A definit=
e problem is that your 'regexList' property element is inside 
> XML commen=
t markers -- "<!-- ... -->" -- so is not a part of the active 
> configurat=
ion.
> 
> A possible problem could be the relative location of this rule wi=
th 
> respect to other scope rules; if this comes early, but then a later r=
ule 
> ACCEPTs the same URIs, the later rule wins.
> 
> You regexes also se=
em a bit suboptimal -- the CSS part could be mixed in 
> with the others, B=
MP doesn't need to be listed twice, you may want the 
> case-insensitive in=
dicator for all suffixes, etc. -- but looks vaguely 
> functional for your =
purposes.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
>
